activities: RPS handles personal data transferred from countries in the European Economic Area (EEA) and Switzerland to the United States that are collected or received in managing our workforce, conducting clinical research activities, conducting marketing activities, and conducting customer information management activities.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Human Resource, Clinical, Marketing, and Customer data (off-line, on-line, manually processed data)
recoursemech: PRA's Privacy Officer receives complaints and reports of non-compliance.  Any investigations which are warranted will be conducted by PRA's Quality Assurance Department, the results of which and any recommended corrective actions will be reported to the Privacy Officer.  PRA will utilize the services of the European Union Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) for dispute resolution and will cooperate and comply with the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).
